Turns anti-aliasing on or off; it is on by default

{| cellspacing="1" cellpadding="4" border="0" style="background: black; color: black"
! bgcolor="silver" | Arg 
! bgcolor="silver" | Type 
! bgcolor="silver" | Description
! bgcolor="silver" | Values
|- 
| bgcolor="white" | active
| bgcolor="white" | [logic!]
| bgcolor="white" | The new value for anti-aliasing behavior
| bgcolor="white" | 
|}

'''Anti-Alias On'''
<TABLE style="color:green; background-color:#fffffcc;" cellpadding="20" cellspacing="0" border="1" width=100%><TR>
<TD WIDTH=60%>
    anti-alias on   line-width 10  circle 200x200 100
</TD>
<TD align=center valign=MIDDLE>[[image:ANTI-ALIAS-2.png|200px 200px]]</TD>
</TR></TABLE>



'''Anti-Alias Off'''
<TABLE style="color:green; background-color:#fffffcc;" cellpadding="20" cellspacing="0" border="1" width=100%><TR>
<TD WIDTH=60%>
    anti-alias off  line-width 10  circle 200x200 100
</TD>
<TD align=center valign=MIDDLE>[[image:ANTI-ALIAS-1.png|200px 200px]]</TD>
</TR></TABLE>



The ANTI-ALIAS command can be used multiple times in DRAW block to easily switch between rendering modes.
<TABLE style="color:green; background-color:#fffffcc;" cellpadding="20" cellspacing="0" border="1" width=100%><TR>
<TD WIDTH=60%>
    anti-alias off
    line-width 10
    circle 150x150 100
    anti-alias on
    line-width 10
    circle 250x250 100
</TD>
<TD align=center valign=MIDDLE>[[image:ANTI-ALIAS-3.png|200px 200px]]</TD>
</TR></TABLE>
